Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: very valuable to connect economic theory to practice. highly recommend for anyone interested in applied economics and environmental economics.

This course is a must for graduate students focused in environmental economics. It should also be very helpful for mater students that have strong background in economics and are applying for graduate programs. The papers reviewed cover well the most recent research in the field and Ken does a great job facilitating the discussion and clarifying the important lessons in each paper or subfield on environmental economics.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The course was excellent. I learned a lot on current research topics, on methods, on the frontier, on what makes an article publishable at a top journal. The presentation were helpful and mostly the discussions were challenging and useful.
learned a lot in the process of presenting technical papers. great group discussion as well.
The whole class was great.
The discussions of the methods used in the papers and on identification.

The great value of this class is to provide students with rigorous tools and methods for applied research in environmental economics. The papers focus on most recent research in the field. The class fits very well with students working on their on papers. Ken does a very good job facilitating the discussions to convey the important lessons and methods in each paper.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: In retrospect I think perhaps one week of Macro would have been enough, perhaps could be replaced by another topic.
would be nice to somehow connect to other seminars on campus. maybe part of the course is requiring attendance to certain economics seminars and talking about the material presented.
Nothing.

The challenge of more advanced classes such as FES905 is to balance scope with depth of discussion. In some classes I did not put the same effort in all papers reviewed especially when I had to present. One suggestion I have seen in other advanced course is to have one paper per class and requires all students to submit as one-page summary of the paper. Maybe also restrict to only two presentations per class instead of three. I would also suggest looking for a seminar type classroom that facilitates discussions.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: helps connect theory to practice!
The course was perfect for my field of interest.

This course fits perfectly with students doing their own research because the main deliverable is a paper and students have the opportunity to discuss their research and get feedback from Ken. Ken did a great great job providing detailed feedback.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: required and also interested in all the papers we reviewed.
I took this class to get a rigorous review of recent research in environmental economics, to learn more about research methods in the field, and to structure the work on my own paper.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes!
exceeded given i think i gained presentation skills which i didn't anticipate.
Exceeded.
Yes.

Yes. There were many subfields of environmental economics covered in this class that I was not familiar with and I had the opportunity to learn about methods that I did not use before such as dynamic optimization.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Highly recommended
great course - do all the readings to get the most out of it!

This course is a must take for graduate students in environmental economics and master students applying for graduate programs. It is important to have strong background in microeconomics and econometrics. It fits perfectly if the student is already working on their own research paper. Ken does a really great job explaining the most recent research in the field and clarifying difficult methodological concepts.
